description: 1605, from re- +‎ furbish, from Middle English furbishen, from Middle French forbir (stem furbiss-, “to clean, polish”), from Frankish *furbēn (“to clean, polish”).

verbs.description: refurbish (third-person singular simple present refurbishes, present participle refurbishing, simple past and past participle refurbished)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To rebuild or replenish with all new material; to restore to original (or better) working order and appearance.
examples: We're having the sitting room refurbished, after a leak damaged a large part of the room.
